transcripts.prompt: Transcribe this image as accurately as possible. Only include the text extracted from the document
transcripts.message:
A1

State of New York SS
Tioga County      On this twentieth day of June in the year 1842, personally appeared before the Court of common Pleas of the said county of Tioga Betsey Holmes, a resident of the town of Ovides in the county of Wyoming and state of New York aged eighty two years, who being first duly sworn according to law doth on her oath make the following declaration, in order to obtain the benefit of the pension made by the Act of Congress passed July 4, 1836 That she is the widow of Moses Holmes, who was an Assistant Commissary in the Revolutionary war and served during the war for which he enlisted , but the particulars of his services she cannot particularly state and she refers to his Pension Declaration under the Act of the 7th June 1832 and the papers accompanying the same for proof of his services. She further states that her late husband, Moses Holmes, in a recent application for an increase of Pension has set forth his services only for the term of two years, as he had been informed and believed, that two years services only was necessary to be set forth in order to secure an increase of his pension; when in truth this Deponent believes and knows that he served for a longer period and as she believes for and during the war.

She further declares that she was married to the said Moses Holmes on the first day of June in the year one thousand seven hundred and eighty that her husband the aforesaid Moses Holmes died on the twenty fourth day of April last part and that she has remained a widow as will now fully appear by reference to the

transcripts.message:
State of New York
Genesee County

On this twentieth day of June in the year 1842, personally appeared before the Court of Common Pleas of the said county of Genesee Betsey Holmes, a resident of the town of Attica in the county of Wyoming and state of New York, aged Eighty two years, who being first duly sworn according to law doth, on her oath make the following declaration, in order to obtain the benefit of the provision made by the Act of Congress passed July 4, 1836: That she is the widow of Moses Holmes, who was an Assistant Commissary in the Revolutionary war and served during the war for which he enlisted; but the particulars of his service she cannot particularly state and she refers to his Pension Declaration under the Act of the 7th June 1832 and the papers accompanying the same for proof of his service. She further states that her late husband, Moses Holmes, in a recent application for an increase of Pension, has set forth his service only for the term of four years, as he had been informed and believed that two years service only was necessary to be set forth in order to secure an increase of his pension, when in truth this declarant believes and knows that he served for a longer period and as she believes for and during the war.

She further declares that she was married to the said Moses Holmes on the first day of June in the year one thousand seven hundred and eighty, that her husband the aforesaid Moses Holmes died on the twenty fourth day of April last past and that she has remained a widow ever since that period, as will more fully appear by reference to the

transcripts.message:
"State of Ohio, Seneca County

On this 26th day of March A.D. one thousand eight hundred and fifty two personally appeared before me John C. Hatch, Clerk of the Court of Common Pleas within and for the County aforesaid, Jacob Rathbone aged seventy three years, a resident of Scipio in said County and State, who being duly sworn according to law, doth on his oath make the following declaration in order to obtain the benefit of the Act of Congress passed June 7th 1832.

That he entered the service of the United States under the following named officers, in the Capacity and during the time herein stated; that he was drafted by Captain Jacob Shupe in the year 1780 as a private soldier in the Company commanded by said Shupe in the Regiment under Colo. John Canfield, and marched to Fort Pitt where we were stationed six months when we were discharged by Lieutenant Colonel Gibson - I further declare that I served three months in the same Company & Regiment at the time of the siege of fort Laurens in the State of Ohio, commanded by Colo. John May - I was discharged at Fort Pitt after said siege & returned to my home in Washington County Pa.

I further declare that I have no record of my service and that I know of no person whose testimony I can procure who can testify to my service, and I hereby relinquish every claim whatever to a pension or annuity except the present, and I do so under the most solemn conviction that I am justly entitled to the same.

his
Jacob Rathbone
mark

We John C. Hatch, Clerk of the Court of Common Pleas within and for the County aforesaid and Daniel P. Vandewater a Justice of the Peace in & for said County do hereby certify that Jacob Rathbone who is personally known to us to be the identical person who made the above declaration, appeared before us on this 26th day of March A.D. 1852 and made the same in our presence after due examination of him apart from his witnesses -

John C. Hatch J.P.C.C.P.
Daniel P. Vandewater J.P."
